page.title: 05Local History-Medbourne Area
page.content: Evidence in recent times has shown that there were several large Roman settlements in the area along the line of the Roman Road including a large town where Medbourne now stands, the name of which is Anglo Saxon - meadow stream; unchanged since the original Domesday book. Evidence of Saxon occupation have also been discovered in fields that have recently come under the plough. The oldest house in Medbourne is the Manor House dating from the late 13th. century. The ironstone for the older houses was originally obtained from Nevill Holt quarry - now disused. The valley was famous for it's beef cattle brought in for fattening on the rich grass pastures - many of the roads and lanes were originally used by drovers walking the cattle to the pastures.
